H0.text: In Greek mythology, who did flute playing shepherd Marsyas challenge to a music contest, the winner of which flayed Marsyas to death for his presumption. Apollo

H1.text: In Greek mythology, who did flute playing shepherd Marsyas challenge to a music contest, the winner of which flayed Marsyas to death for his presumption. Dionysus

H2.text: In Greek mythology, who did flute playing shepherd Marsyas challenge to a music contest, the winner of which flayed Marsyas to death for his presumption. Orpheus

H3.text: In Greek mythology, who did flute playing shepherd Marsyas challenge to a music contest, the winner of which flayed Marsyas to death for his presumption. Ph√©vos

A4.text: Marsyas challenged Apollo to a musical contest.

A5.text: Apollo flayed Marsyas for his hubris after the contest.
